intro: Cyrtandromoea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyrtandromoea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Cyrtandromoea angustifolia is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
